com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.conversion

Class BasicConverter<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.conversion.BasicConverter<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - - output type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Converter<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CollectionConverter, EmptyConverter, EnumConverter, HandleConverter, ObjectArrayConverter, PrimitiveArrayConverter, PrimitiveConverter, PropertyConverter, WrapperConverter

    public abstract class BasicConverter<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Converter<T>
    A basic implementation which stores the output type

      • convertSpecial

        protected abstract T convertSpecial(java.lang.Object value,
               java.lang.Class<?> valueType,
               T def)
        Called when a non-null and uncastable object needs to be converted. If such a thing is not supported, return def in the method body.

        This method needs to be implemented to satisfy the BasicConverter system. Null check and output assigning checks are already performed before this call.

        Parameters:
        value - to convert (not null and can not be cast to the output type)
        valueType - of the value
        def - to return on failure
        Returns:
        converted value, or def on failure

      • isCastingSupported

        public boolean isCastingSupported()
        Description copied from interface: Converter
        Checks whether the returned output value can be casted to another type
        This should only be supported when the returned type can be an extension of the output type
        Typically, interfaces do not support this, as they can conflict with other converters

        Do not give a converter for multipurpose types this property! For example, an Object converter would end up being used for all cases, rendering isCastingSupported unusable globally.

        Specified by:
        isCastingSupported in interface Converter<T>
        Returns:
        True if casting is supported, False if not

      • isRegisterSupported

        public boolean isRegisterSupported()
        Description copied from interface: Converter
        Checks whether this converter supports registering in the Conversion look-up table. If this converter produces something that has to do with reading a field or method, and not actual conversion, this should be set to True.
        Specified by:
        isRegisterSupported in interface Converter<T>
        Returns:
        True if Conversion table registration is enabled, False if not

        Specified by:
        formPair in interface Converter<T>

        Returns:
